boardgame.name: Myth
Myth
boardgame.description: Myth is a fully co-operative fantasy game. Players take on the role of one of 5 different heroes working together to defeat the Darkness. Each hero has a different skill set which represented by a unique deck of cards. Players spend Action Points by using cards. Once a certain amount of Action Points have been spent the Darkness fights back by activating monster lairs, spawning monster captains and eventually the Boss._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A complete game in Myth is called a Story. Each Story is played over three Acts. Acts can be played sequentially, or can be split up over three different game sessions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players' avatars within a Story are called Heroes. Myth Heroes are clothed in immense power, able to reave all but the mightiest foes. However, this power must be balanced lest the Darkness take too much notice. Players must weigh their actions against the Threat each will bring, with the consequences of awakening more evil and bringing doom on the party's endeavors. And be careful they must, as the Darkness is formidable and eager to snatch glory from the valiant._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Heroes are controlled through an intuitive Hero Deck (videos for each Hero can be found in the Game Play Videos section below). Each deck plays uniquely and allows players more freedom of action and the ability to truly impact the Story each and every Act. Yet, cooperation is the key to victory and bloody fortune. Players must communicate, interact, and assist each other or surely the Darkness will cover all._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Myth is a fully cooperative game. There is no player controlling the Darkness. The Darkness is governed by a set of rules unique to each Boss Deck and is activated through Hero actions. If the Heroes get overzealous, then the Darkness pushes back by activating Lairs, spawning Captains, and punishing the Heroes with devious Events. If the Heroes take a more subtle approach, then the Darkness reacts by reducing the potential for treasure and rewards. Without the treasures and equipment to upgrade, the Heroes will find each Act more difficult and eventually fail. The dynamic nature of the Darkness really lends a more fluid feel to the Story. Players aren't being driven by properties out of their control, nor are they being shepherded by a person whose skill has a direct impact on the enjoyment of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Myth is a fun fantasy romp where players feel truly heroic. In the playing of the game, the players are creating their own mythos. These stories are the ones carried away from the table, becoming myths themselves. And these are the myths, with friends and family, that we carry with us; telling and retelling our endeavors at the mead benches, earning treasured smiles and laughter._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Myth Captain level pledge, including stretch goals. This level does NOT include the 1 per backer stretch goals which I believe are just the Twilight Knight and Trickster. This does include the following: -Base game -Razor Fiend Mini boss -Expansion set 1 (10 Skeleton Minions, 2 Skeleton Captains) -Kickstarter exclusive Rat Mini Boss -2 extra Orc Captains, 2 extra Skeleton Captains, 2 extra Arachnid Captains -6 arachnids, 6 orcs, 6 skeletons -Hero deck card sleeves with hero artwork for each base game class -Alternate gender heroe miniatures for base game -Expansion set 2 (10 elemental minions, and 2 captains) -Skeleton boss huge miniature with 10 card deck -1 of each sculpted lairs and traps -Large Orc Boss miniature with 10 card deck -Set of 10 new world tiles -Expansion set 3 (10 rat minions, 2 rat captains) -Extra 6 skeleton minions, 6 rats, and 6 elementals -Enormous Rat boss miniature with 10 card deck -2 extra Rat captains, 2 extra elemental captains -Expansion set 4 (10 cyclops minions, 2 cyclops captains) -Minotaur Mini Boss miniature -Kickstarter exclusive Metal hero tokens and coins -Kickstarter exclusive Connor Miniature Mini-Boss and Connor Quest deck -15 Kickstarter exclusive additional story quests (this was upped from the original number of 10 -Slaughterfield tile set (5 tiles) -Kickstarter exclusive Torchbearer follower -Cyclops boss miniature with 10 card deck -Marcus the ready ally miniature -Fire drake miniature with 10 card boss deck It is my understanding that the Trickster and the Twilight Knight are the only two 1 per backer stretch goals which are not included. I looked back over the Kickstarter and that seems to be the case. I have previously sold my Sedition Wars pledge level months before the product actually shipped. That went very smoothly and I can provide the user as a reference (it was sold via bartertown.com forums). Shipping for all of this will be $20. If it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s split into multiple shipments (if, for instance, some of the stretch goals hit a snag and are delayed), no additional shipping will be added and I will cover the cost.

Are you one of the unwashed masses lamenting your misfortune at having missed the kickstarter for one of the most polarizing games in recent boardgamegeek history? Do you gnash your teeth and grip your computer keyboard in impotence and rage, knowing you can’t contribute in any meaningful way to the irate threads raging across this game’s page? Would you jump at the chance to pay a reasonable price for a kickstarter pledge, and avoid those online scalpers and their outrageous price hikes? Well, my friend. Have I got an offer for you. I’m selling my captain’s pledge with lots of add on goodies for $300, I’ll pay shipping (or the first 40-50 bucks worth of shipping, including insurance for $250. If you want it fast, you’ll be responsible for the difference). The game is like new (opened, everything punched, those cards with sleeves are sleeved, played 2-3 times) and all the wave 2 stuff is brand new (nothing is punched, opened or overly messed with, but everything was as inventoried as possible without breaking the cellophane. Please read the full list below, however.) This was a ridiculously successful KS, and it came with an absurd amount of goodies. I can’t keep it all straight in my head, and if you’re new to the party, I’d be impressed if you could sort it all out. Here’s a nice graphic of what the Captain’s pledge includes (http://keithloweart.com/pledge_level_tally_04.12.jpg). This purchase also includes a bunch of add ons, all noted below. The price I’m asking for covers the cost of my pledge plus lots of add ons, plus BGG’s commission, plus whatever the heck shipping and insurance will be (i.e., I’m not making money here, but after all I’ve suffered with this game, I’m not up for losing much money either…). And, as a tithe to my toddler son, he has demanded that we keep 3 orcs, 4 skeletons, and one arachnid captain (the giant scorpion figure). These were the figures you get too many of in the Captain’s pledge anyway, so this won’t affect gameplay in any significant way. Here’s what you get (add ons are noted below for your viewing pleasure and to facilitate your bragging about them to your friends post haste): - Complete retail version of the game. Includes card sleeves for all the heroes. - Nearly complete Captain pledge (see notes about the tithe my son imposed. This won’t affect normal gameplay as we got a silly amount of figures in the Captain pledge) - Cool but mostly useless kickstarter metal tags for each of your heroes. Nifty, but hard to read. - Cool and totally rad kickstarter metal treasure tokens. Be the envy of your gaming buddies! - 10 new boardgame tiles - 10 kickstarter exclusive story quests - 5 Slaughterfield Tiles and the slaughterfield deck of cards to play this mode of the game. - 1 Counter sheet (Title tokens, Elder Spriggan tokens, etc. - this is the unpunched sheet that’ll you’ll find in the game box) - Overview _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Walkthrough black and white booklet. The !@#*! thing they forgot to add the first time around that largely led to the storm of controversy over this game! - Quest Deck 1 (I think this was some extra thing they threw in our box. Not quite sure of its provenance, importance, pedigree, or relevance. But you can have it) - The Skald Hero (two figures, cards, sleeves), which I picked up as an add on - The Spriggan Hero (one figure, cards, sleeves), which I picked up as an add on - The Treasure expansion (cards), which I picked up as an add on - The Quest expansion (cards), which I picked up as an add on - The Elemental Boss (one big figure, cards), which I picked up as an add on - The evil Agents (3 figures, cards), which I picked up as an add on - Tuck boxes for all your hero cards (yes, they fit the sleeved cards, you’re welcome) printed out and assembled from the files posted by a hard working community member here at the ‘geek. Totally rad? Yes, yes they are. (even if perhaps not as professional as if MegaCon had done ‘em, but hey. You get what you pay for, right?) - A bunch of other print outs: FAQs, hints on how to play the base game dudes, some other random stuff that you may or may not find helpful An obscene amount of minis, detailed below - There’s probably stuff I’m forgetting. But maybe not? You’ll find out soon, right? Here’s an annotated inventory of all the figures you get in this game. Unless noted below, these are all Captains pledge or add on figures. Those that use them, include their respective decks. They look like they’re all there too (but I just counted the decks and did not open/unwrap them). Can you just see how apoplectic with hysterical joy you will be upon opening this box? Can you? Bosses 1 Crawler Boss + cards (from the base game) 1 Orc Boss + cards 1 Rat Boss + cards 1 Cyclops Boss + cards 1 Fire Drake + cards 1 Skeleton Boss + cards (OK, gird your loins. This guy looks like he bent or broke in transit. You’ll need to get out your hobby glue and give this guy some serious attention. I can’t quite tell what’s going on in the baggie, but this was not a terribly well designed mini and you’ll need to be prepared to fix him) 1 Elemental boss + cards (add on!) Mini-Bosses (each with stat card) Yardu the undead giant mini boss (from the base game) Twilight Knight mini boss + Orange Item card, this is a KS limited edition thing. You will be much cooler than you are now when you own this. Big rat thing with a goblin on top Mini-Boss. Another KS exclusive? You bet! Minotaur Mini-Boss Conner Mini Boss (Dog) + Conner_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Toy quest card. Helloooo another KS exclusive! Hot damn! Razorfiend mini boss. This is another KS exclusive/promo thing. Again, your self worth will balloon once this arrives on your doorstep Donnchadh (3 musketeer looking guy) + character deck card Those three dastardly agent figures! (add on! With cards!) Minions/Captains 18 Skeleton Minions (Compliments of my son’s tithe) 4 Skeleton Captains 4 Orc Captains (some from the base game, some from kickstarter) 3 Arachnid Captains (Compliments of my son’s tithe; some from base game, some from kickstarter) 20 Arachnids (some from the base game, some from kickstarter) 17 Orcs (Compliments of my son’s tithe; some from the base game, some from kickstarter) 16 Elemental Minions 2 Elemental Captains 16 Rat Minions 2 Rat Captains 10 Cyclops Minions 2 Cyclops Captains Heroes/Allies. All heroes come with their cards and sleeves. 10 Hero figures (base set, male and female figures. Some from the base game, some from kickstarter) 2 Trickster Heroes (male and female) along with their deck, and 6 plastic traps they can play. Another KS exclusive? Yes. Will your awesomeness know no bounds? It shall indeed. 1 Marcus the Ready ally 1 Torchbearer ally (metal) 2 Skald Heroes (male and female; they’re bards), another hero class that you’ll get because you so need it and there’s no way there’s enough playability in the base captains pledge! (add on!) The weird metal spriggan hero (add on) that is another exclusive model, and will certainly increase your appeal to those to whom you want your appeal increased*. (*This statement has not been assessed by the FDA. Side effects may include nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, thickening skin, and other tree-like qualities) Misc Stuff 6 Lairs that you can use instead of the cardboard tokens that come with the base game

Mercs (MCX5901) Myth is a fully co-operative fantasy game. Players take on the role of one of 5 different heroes working together to defeat the Darkness. Each hero has a different skill set which represented by a unique deck of cards. Players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; avatars within a Story are called Heroes. Myth Heroes are clothed in immense power, able to reave all but the mightiest foes. Heroes are controlled through an intuitive Hero Deck. Each deck plays uniquely and allows players more freedom of action and the ability to truly impact the Story each and every Act. Yet, cooperation is the key to victory and bloody fortune. Players must communicate, interact, and assist each other or surely the Darkness will cover all. No player controlling the Darkness. The Darkness is governed by a set of rules unique to each Boss Deck and is activated through Hero actions. If the Heroes get overzealous, then the Darkness pushes back by activating Lairs, spawning Captains, and punishing the Heroes with devious Events. If the Heroes take a more subtle approach, then the Darkness reacts by reducing the potential for treasure and rewards. Without the treasures and equipment to upgrade, the Heroes will find each Act more difficult and eventually fail. The dynamic nature of the Darkness really lends a more fluid feel to the Story. Players aren_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t being driven by properties out of their control, nor are they being shepherded by a person whose skill has a direct impact on the enjoyment of the game. Myth is a fun fantasy romp where players feel truly heroic. In the playing of the game, the players are creating their own mythos. These stories are the ones carried away from the table, becoming myths themselves. And these are the myths, with friends and family, that we carry with us; telling and retelling our endeavors at the mead benches, earning treasured smiles and laughter.

This is a full KS1 Captain pledge for Myth and several add-ons. It will include the 2.0 materials for it all, once MCG prints and ships all the 2.0 materials to me. Once I get them, I will forward them to the purchaser of this pledge at no extra charge. All the stretch goals are included, which also includes the rare and coveted Twilight Knight boss, and Donnchahd (sp??) and several of the add-ons that affected the game play. These include Ia, the Foundation elemental boss, The 3 Agents of Darkness, an extra set of lairs, Item Pack 1 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 2, Quest Packs 1 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 2, sleeves for all the heroes, the Skald Hero, and the Spriggan hero. Some of the miniatures have been painted, and you can see them all here: http://boardgamegeek.com/images/boardgame/all?username=Ghool All I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m wanting to do is get what I paid for the pledge. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m selling it because I have found a dungeon crawl that is less complicated that I am able to play with my kids. Myth has sat unused for two years due to the complexity. All of the painted miniatures are painted well, and look great on the table. Most of the heroes are painted, as are the traps and a couple of the bosses. The pledge is largely un-painted, and all of the insectoid minions have had their bases and giant, ugly posts removed from their undersides. The orc lairs are also removed from their plain bases, and I have built a scenic and thematic base for both. Otherwise the game is in brand new condition. Keep in mind that this is 20lb. box that_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s quite large. It will be costly to ship, but the amount of stuff in it is astronomical. This is a great starting point for anyone wishing to get into Myth, and has plenty to keep anyone entertained for a long time. Buyer will pay actual shipping costs in addition to the price.
